Intro.LevelMaker.1: Do you want to see the level editor tutorial?
Intro.LevelMaker.2: In the level editor you can make your own maps, which you can share with others!
Intro.LevelMaker.3: Click on a tile and use the directional buttons to create a new ghost tile.
Intro.LevelMaker.4: Notice that the tile has guides matching the color of the directional buttons!
Intro.LevelMaker.5: You can confirm the ghost tile by tapping twice the directional button.
Intro.LevelMaker.6: Clicking on the ghost tile works too!
Intro.LevelMaker.7: Or just use the confirm button!
Intro.LevelMaker.8: Use the orientation buttoms to make the tiles go up, down or stay plain.
Intro.LevelMaker.9: When you are ready save the map details, after saving a new button will appear that will let you quicksave.
Intro.LevelMaker.10: Once saved the level will appear in your gallery, you can press the share button to share codes.
Intro.LevelMaker.11: In the gallery you can import other levels using the share code in the Others section.
Intro.LevelMaker.12: And that's it! Want to make some new levels? Tap again to finish the tutorial.
Intro.Level.1: Do you want to see the gameplay tutorial?
Intro.Level.2: Click on a tile to remove it and others will move to take its place!
Intro.Level.3: When three or more of the same color are together you get a combo!
Intro.Level.4: The little dots serve as a guide to know which tiles will move!
Intro.Level.5: When you feel ready you can disable them in the options! It's faster!
Intro.Level.6: Combine four in a straight line to get a power up that clears tiles in line!
Intro.Level.7: Combine 5 to get a power up that removes all the tiles that match a color!
Intro.Level.8: And that's it! Are you ready for the challenge? Tap again to finish the tutorial.
